definition: to support/to provide support for/to maintain
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Chen accuses his son of being not filial and asks for solatium .
sentences.chinese: 陈平状告儿子不孝，并且索要赡养费。

sentences.english: A man is nothing who doesn't provide for his parents.
sentences.chinese: 一个人如果连父母都不赡养，就不称其为人了。

sentences.english: China’s Confucian tradition places strong emphasis on the obligation to care for parents.
sentences.chinese: 中国儒家文化特别重视赡养父母的义务。

sentences.english: Are you or any dependents now pregnant?
sentences.chinese: 您本人或任何受赡养人目前是否怀孕？

sentences.english: He gave his house to his ex-wife, and pays to support his parents.
sentences.chinese: 他把房子给了他的妻子，他来赡养自己的父母。

sentences.english: A man is nothing who doesn't provide ror his parents.
sentences.chinese: 一个人如果连父母都不赡养，就不称其为人了。

sentences.english: He listed four dependents on his income-tax form.
sentences.chinese: 他在所得税表格上填写了四个受赡养人。

sentences.english: She is also seeking spousal support from Parker.
sentences.chinese: 另外，她也要求从帕克那里获得离婚赡养费。
也可能症结是他拿不出赡养费。

sentences.english: That guy is a bastard, he refuses to support his parents.
sentences.chinese: 这家伙不赡养父母，真是个混蛋。

sentences.english: China's constitution stipulates that grown-up children are duty-bound to support their parents.
sentences.chinese: 中国宪法规定赡养父母是成年子女义不容辞的责任。

sentences.english: Every child bares the responsibility and obligation of supporting the old.
sentences.chinese: 每位子女都负有赡养老人的责任和义务。

sentences.english: I thought you were too proud take alimony .
sentences.chinese: 我以为你爱面子不爱赡养费呢。

sentences.english: Sons, on the other hand, stay home and take care of the parents as they grow old.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，儿子留在家里，在长大后要赡养父母。

sentences.english: Children cannot be relieved from supporting their parents.
sentences.chinese: 子女不能不履行赡养父母的义务。

sentences.english: It's not enough for the government to build a social-security system to suport the old.
sentences.chinese: 由政府建立一个社会保障体系赡养老人还远远不够。

definition: to look after one's aged parents and arrange proper burial after they die
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
